CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. A15, reads: "IT WAS A BUSY NIGHT - The grand opening of Stanley Williams' new Homewood tavern last Monday attracted a continuous flow of patrons who kept bartenders and waitresses 'on the jump' from early in afternoon until closing time. The above view shows the 20-seat bar filled to capacity, as bartenders work feverishly to give speedy service.  Also in the dining section, a large crowd sampled the good food, which Stanley is featuring. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Crowd of men, including one with camera, and bartender leaning down in foreground; and women, including one seated second from right wearing dress with light colored bow at collar, gathered at bar in Stanley's Tavern, Homewood
